revised_title: Regulation of Thymidine Phosphorylation in Nucleate and Anucleate Acetabularia Cells
tldr: The study investigates the regulation of thymidine phosphorylation in nucleate and anucleate cells of Acetabularia, a type of sea squirt. The research shows that the rate of thymidine phosphorylation increases during the growth of the stalk and the formation of the species-specific cap. This increase occurs independently of the cell nucleus, suggesting that there is a cytoplasmic regulation of enzymes involved in DNA synthesis.
